intro: Spigelia heliotropioides, commonly known as the purpleroot or heliotrope spigelia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants with milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are typically hairy and have a distinctive purple or reddish hue on the underside. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a spurred corolla. The root system is thick and fleshy, which gives the plant its common name and contributes to its medicinal significance in traditional herbal medicine.
